title: The HPV vaccine is not a free pass: why regular pap smears still matter
description: The HPV vaccine does not replace Pap smears. Vaccination and screening must go hand in hand. The HPV vaccine protects against the most common high-risk strains of the virus that cause cervical cancer, but this means there remains a small but significant risk of cervical cell changes even after vaccination

India vs Pakistan bilateral series possible? BCCI reveals ultimate condition
description: India are unlikely to play a bilateral series with Pakistan anytime soon. BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla says the board will follow the Indian government’s guidance. “I don't think it's possible to have bilateral tours in the current situation,” he added. India last played Pakistan in 2012-13 and now follows a “third soil” policy for matches. Tensions increased after Operation Sindoor in 2025, and security concerns remain high, recalling the 2009 attack on the Sri Lankan team in Lahore.

A brave 12-year-old child's quick thinking and 911 call alerted authorities. Police arrived swiftly, leading to the arrest of the suspect. The children present escaped unharmed. The Consulate General of India in Atlanta is providing assistance.

title: 'Unjust to voters, unfair to democracy': Amartya Sen says 'SIR in Bengal done in hurry'
description: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen voiced concerns over West Bengal's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, saying the exercise is "being done in a hurry," further calling it an unjust to voters and a threat to democratic participation. He highlighted personal challenges with documentation and warned that the underprivileged and minority communities are most at risk of exclusion.

title: Samson in trouble? Keeper's place in team questioned after Kishan's heroics
description: Former India batter Aakash Chopra questions Sanju Samson's T20I spot against New Zealand, citing repeated dismissals. Despite India's series lead, Samson's struggles, particularly his driving shots, are concerning. With Ishan Kishan in form and the T20 World Cup approaching, Samson faces mounting pressure to perform, even on his home ground.

title: BJP national president Nitin Nabin to visit Bengal next week to chart roadmap for Assembly polls
UP shocker: FIR against 5 Muslim minors for ‘making’ Hindu girl wear burqa in Moradabad
description: An FIR was filed against five minor Muslim girls in Moradabad for allegedly making their Hindu friend wear a burqa. The incident, which occurred in December 2025, came to light after the girl's brother filed a complaint. Police are investigating the motive behind the alleged act, with the anti-conversion law carrying a severe penalty.

title: ‘Salman Khan’s family is like Hum Saath Saath Hain’: Seema Sajdeh says Khans supported her during fights with Sohail
Heat scale touching five, cramps and some extra coffee: How Australian Open stars are coping amid sweltering heat
‘Mardaani 3’ OTT release: When and where to watch YRF’s cop thriller after theatrical release
description: 'Mardaani 3', starring Rani Mukerji as tough cop Shivani Shivaji Roy, releases in theatres on January 30, 2026. Produced by Yash Raj Films and directed by Abhiraj Minawala, the film streams on Netflix from March 27 after a 56-day theatrical run, exploring human trafficking and introducing the villain Amma, played by Mallika Prasad.

title: ‘No matter how many books I read…’: Hrithik Roshan gets candid about his never-ending obsession with ‘Bollywood biceps’

‘Military-style discipline’: An employee’s account of how one leaked transcript shattered trust at work
description: An employee recounts how a management push for control unraveled after a recorded meeting captured leaders discussing staff in harsh terms, including plans for “military-style discipline.” When the transcript was accidentally shared with the entire team, trust collapsed overnight. What followed were biased evaluations, targeted employees, and a deeply toxic workplace culture. The incident highlights how performative transparency and power-driven leadership can quickly erode morale and force workers to consider exit over endurance.

title: When Novak Djokovic made 100 unforced errors in a match — and still won — at the Australian Open

Congress vs Tharoor escalates: Another MP calls him 'not a big part'
description: Congress MP Imran Masood stated Shashi Tharoor is "not a big part" of the party, intensifying the rift. Tharoor skipped a crucial Kerala poll meeting for a literature festival, defending his stance on Operation Sindoor and stating concerns should be raised internally.

title: More stray dog killings come to light in Telanagana, 300 found buried in one spot
Noida Authority Gets New CEO: Krishna Karunesh appointed after protests; replaces Lokesh M
description: Krishna Karunesh, a 2011-batch IAS officer, has taken over as the new CEO of Noida Authority, replacing Lokesh M. This change follows a recent controversy surrounding the death of a software engineer and subsequent protests alleging negligence. Karunesh, previously the District Magistrate of Gorakhpur, brings a wealth of administrative experience to his new role.

TikTok survives in the US, thanks to a new corporate structure. Could India have taken the same road?
When big-fat weddings become soft targets for gangs
description: Punjab's wedding venues are becoming scenes of violence, with recent shootings including an AAP sarpanch's murder in Amritsar and a deadly gang shootout in Ludhiana. These incidents highlight lax firearm ban enforcement, poor venue security, and the alarming normalization of guns at social gatherings, leaving communities fearful.

'Didn't violate party position': Tharoor breaks silence amid rift buzz; defends stand on Op Sindoor
description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has clarified his stance on party lines. He stated his only public disagreement was on Operation Sindoor and India's counterterrorism position. Tharoor emphasized national interest above political differences. His remarks follow reports of internal party friction and his absence from a key meeting. He recalled past events and leaders' views on national security.

Google CEO Sundar Pichai sells shares worth $10.6 million, now owns …
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai sold over 30,000 Alphabet Class C shares for approximately $10.6 million on January 21, 2026. This transaction occurred under a pre-established Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The sale follows a strong year for Google stock, driven by AI advancements and a significant market valuation.

Global institutions view India as base for financial, tech operations: GIFT City CEO
WWE 2K26 release date, Attitude Era edition, platforms, roster, and more details
description: WWE 2K26 has been officially announced, set for release by March 31, 2026, with pre-orders opening January 30, 2026. The game will feature significant upgrades, a CM Punk Showcase mode, a returning Island mode with a new storyline, and new match types. An Attitude Era Edition celebrating iconic superstars has also been revealed.

title: Bengali? Yes, SIR. Brahmin? Yes, SIR. Go, fall in line
description: Bengal's voters, including Mukherjees and Banerjees, face hearings over "logical discrepancies" in surnames. The Election Commission's software flags historical variations like Mukhopadhyay for Mukherjee, a simplification by the British. Many now prefer shorter versions, leading to confusion and summons, prompting criticism from CM Mamata Banerjee about cultural insensitivity.

title: Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
description: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Reggie Miller says Stephen Curry should call Giannis as Father Time looms
description: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
description: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott’s dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott’s firing.

title: Netflix rejects Paramount’s offer, says nothing else other than Oracle’s backing
description: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Amazon layoffs 'announced'; company set to cut thousands of jobs
description: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.
